firestore.reasoning: The Firestore structure is designed to ensure Authorization Independence, QAPs, and ease of maintenance. User data is stored under `/users/{userId}` for private user data. Lectures, MCQs, and Written Questions are stored in top-level collections to allow for listing all lectures/questions without requiring user context, supporting QAPs. The `lastLecture` field in the User document stores the ID of the last accessed lecture. A new top-level collection `examResults` is added to store analytics data. This collection can be read by any user to generate comparative statistics but writing to it is controlled to ensure data integrity.
